Package interactr.cs.kuleuven.be.ui

Class PaintBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • interactr.cs.kuleuven.be.ui.PaintBoard

  • public class PaintBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of paint boards for drawing basic geometric shapes. Paint boards allow for encapsulation of how it is, exactly, that the drawing is done.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PaintBoard​(DiagramWindow diagramWindow, DiagramController diagramController)
      Initialize this new paint board with given diagram window and diagram controller.

    • Method Summary

      void drawLine​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Draw a line at given start and end coordinates on this paint board.
      void drawOval​(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draw an oval at given coordinate of given width and height in this paint board.
      void drawRectangle​(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draw a rectangle of given width and height at the given coordinates on this paint board.

      Draw the given string at the given coordinate.

      Fill a rectangle of given width and height at the given coordinates on this paint board.

      • PaintBoard

        public PaintBoard​(DiagramWindow diagramWindow,
                  DiagramController diagramController)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this new paint board with given diagram window and diagram controller.
        Parameters:
        diagramWindow - The diagram window to associate this paint board with.
        diagramController - The diagram controller to associate this paint board with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given window is nil.

        Make this paint board paint its contents in the given graphics context.
        Parameters:

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine​(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2)
        Draw a line at given start and end coordinates on this paint board.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The start x coordinate for the line.
        y1 - The start y coordinate for the line.
        x2 - The end x coordinate for the line.
        y2 - The end y coordinate for the line.

                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Draw a rectangle of given width and height at the given coordinates on this paint board.
        Parameters:

        y - The start y coordinate for the line.
        width - The end x coordinate for the line.
        height - The end y coordinate for the line.

      • drawOval

        public void drawOval​(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Draw an oval at given coordinate of given width and height in this paint board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the center of the oval that is to be drawn.
        y - The y coordinate of the center of the oval that is to be drawn.
        width - The width of the oval that is to be drawn.
        height - The height of the oval that is to be drawn.

                       int x,
                       int y)
        Draw the given string at the given coordinate.
        Parameters:
        string - The string that is to be drawn.
        x - The x coordinate to draw at.
        y - The y coordinate to draw at.

        public void fillRectangle​(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Fill a rectangle of given width and height at the given coordinates on this paint board.
        Parameters:

        y - The start y coordinate for the line.
        width - The end x coordinate for the line.
        height - The end y coordinate for the line.

      • translateOrigin

        public void translateOrigin​(int x,
                            int y)
        Translate the origin of this paintboard to the given coordinate. All drawing in subsequent calls will be relative to this new origin.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x coordinate for the origin.
        y - The new y coordinate for the origin.
